text: Marin Glavaš (born 17 March 1992) is a Croatian professional footballer who plays as a winger. ==Club career== Glavaš, originally from Imotski, moved to Osijek aged 15. He made his league debut on 6 August 2011 in a 4–0 home win against NK Zagreb, at 19 years of age, coming in for Srđan Vidaković in the 84th minute.Osijek vs. Zagreb 4 - 0 at soccerway.com He scored his first league goal in the 2–0 home win against Hajduk Split on 24 August 2014.OSIJEK - HAJDUK 2-0 Tudorove rezerve zakazale, Baraban i Glavaš pogodili za slavlje Osijeka at Jutarnji List In February 2016, Glavaš joined Ararat Yerevan for their training camp in the United States, joining them permanently on 24 February. In March 2017, Glavaš signed for Finnish second tier club Oulu for the 2017 season. After spending 2 years in Austria playing for four different clubs, Glavaš signed a six month contract with a possibility of a two year extension with Bosnian Premier League club Široki Brijeg on 23 January 2020. He made his official debut for Široki Brijeg in a 3–2 away win against Mladost Doboj Kakanj on 29 February 2020. Glavaš left Široki Brijeg on 10 June 2020 after his contract with the club expired. ==References== ==External links== * *Marin Glavaš at Sportnet.hr *Marin Glavaš at Flashscore Category:1992 births Category:Living people Category:Sportspeople from Imotski Category:Croatian footballers Category:Croatian expatriate footballers Category:Croatia youth international footballers Category:Association football wingers Category:Croatian First Football League players Category:Slovenian PrvaLiga players Category:Austrian Football Second League players Category:Premier League of Bosnia and Herzegovina players Category:NK Osijek players Category:FC ViOn Zlaté Moravce players Category:NK Celje players Category:SV Horn players Category:SC Weiz players Category:USV Allerheiligen players Category:Austrian Regionalliga players Category:NK Široki Brijeg players Category:Slovak Super Liga players Category:Expatriate footballers in Slovakia Category:Expatriate footballers in Armenia Category:Expatriate footballers in Slovenia Category:Expatriate footballers in Finland Category:Croatian expatriate sportspeople in Slovakia Category:Croatian expatriate sportspeople in Slovenia Category:Croatian expatriate sportspeople in Finland Category:Croatian expatriate sportspeople in Armenia Category:Croatian people of Bosnia and Herzegovina descent
title: Marin Glavaš
